result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC>=0.15) and Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st)(PAC>=0.15). The defendant was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC>=0.15) and the other charge, Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st)(PAC>=0.15) was dismissed by the court.

  • Dan G Miller was found guilty of Cause Injury/Operate While und.Influence (1st) (PAC>=0.15), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied to fine, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Sheriff's Dept. Transcript fee to be forwarded to Waukesha County DA's Office. Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full.

Straight Time. Commencing forthwith. Sentence Credit of 1 day was granted. *Note - Defendant is allowed Huber release on Wednesday, December 9, 2015 for the purpose of attending the Victim Impact Panel meeting in Milwaukee. Times to be forwarded to jail by attorney. Court allows release (1 1/2hour) prior to the meeting and (1 1/2hr) after the VIP's completion time on 12/09/15.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Perform Alcohol Assessment. 
Attend the Victim Impact Panel meeting on 12/09/15 or serve penalty of 30 days Huber, consecutive for non-attendance.
Case 14TR4611 was dismissed and read in. Cases 14TR5754 and 14TR5610 were dismissed.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: (Fax) Dated 11/30/15, from Atty Schiro to Judge Carter, confirming the Defendant's attendance at a Victim Impact Panel on 12/09/15 in Milwaukee.

Defendant Dan G Miller in court with Attorney John Scott Schiro.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Schiro makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  JAIL:  30 days (straight time) - 1 day credit. NOTE:  Defendant is allowed huber release on Wednesday, December 9, 2015 to attend Victim Impact Panel in Milwaukee County (times to be provided by Attorney John Schiro (will be faxed to the jail).  Court is allowing Defendant's huber release 1 1/2 hour prior to VIP time and 1 1/2 hour after VIP's completion time on 12/9/15).  Defendant taken into custody.   

FINE: $1,192.00 (to be paid out of cash bail posted-remainder to be refunded to poster)

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department (to be paid out of cash bail posted). 

TRANSCRIPT FEE:  $22.00 paid to Waukesha County District Attorney's Office (to be paid out of cash bail posted)

DL REVOCATION: 16 months

IGNITION INTERLOCK: 16 months

Victim Impact Panel on:  Defendant will be attending a Victim Impact Panel in MILWAUKEE COUNTY on December 9, 2015.  Defendant to serve 30 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH
